resources.string: Transportation planners and policy makers collect information about your daily travel patterns (i.e. how, when and why people move from one place to another) to understand the mobility behaviour of that particular city/region. This will help us to improve certain services such as public transportation system and reduce traffic chocks in a sustainable manner. Therefore, we, research team from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati are collecting data for case studies. So, we are asking you to please help us by participating in the survey. However, the participation is voluntary. It is assured that the participant’s data is kept confidential.
Developed by:Arpan Konar and Durgesh Yadav Under A.V.A. Bharat Kumar
1. Data recording starts as soon as app is started and continuously records data in the background except during 1 AM to 5 AM.
2. In settings you can select if you want to record rotation data along with accelerometer,magnetometer and gps data.
3. Data recording can be started and stopped from the buttons on the action bar.
4. Frequency of data recording can be adjusted from settings.

5. Data uploading takes place in the background. After every 100000 recordings new file is created and the files are uploaded to server and deleted from phone storage to save memory.Server address(172.16.*.*) needs to be bypassed in wifi.Psiphon needs to be turned off.
1. When you are in home and change device orientation,the app crashes.
1. Redmi users should not clean the memory,otherwise the background recording also stops.
2. Cellular network based location requests are not accepted for some mobiles.
3. During opening the app for the first time you have to be connected to the network to register and start the app.
1. Accelerometer - Measures the acceleration force in m/s^2 that is applied to a device on all three physical axes (x, y, and z), including the force of gravity
2. Magnetometer - Measures the ambient geomagnetic field for all three physical axes (x, y, z) in μT. It may not be present in some mobiles.
3. Rotation Sensor - Measures the orientation of a device by providing the three elements of the device\'s rotation vector
4. Gps - This gives the location in latitude and longitude.It is present in all mobiles.
Please Note: You need to bypass the server address(172.16.*.*) to register and upload data if it doesn\'t work.Please go to corresponding wifi and change the settings.Psiphon needs to be off.
